ygData.subject: Re: Now about 1hs vs 2hs Re: Rangers and warriors
ygData.msgSnippet: noticing your reposte damage is kinda hard....what it says it exactally  what it says when you do a normal attack.  Note:  just because you get a reposte
ygData.messageBody:
noticing your reposte damage is kinda hard....what it says it exactally what it says when you do a normal attack. Note: just because you get a reposte attack doesn't mean you hit, just means you get the extra swing.

>>> James Wofford <James.Wofford@...> 5.24.99 3:28:29 PM >>>
From: James Wofford <James.Wofford@...>

I have riposte, and see messages that I use it all the time. Tho I have
never seen any message containing an amount of damage that I have caused. I
would also like to learn anything anyone can tell me about it. (I will try
to check closely tonight to see about the messages incase no one ghas info.
it may be that I just have the messages turned off that relate to riposte
and similiar damage)

Dyvim Kincaid
Stormriders of Cazic Thule

> -----Original Message-----
> From: David Rogers [mailto:derogers334@...]
> Sent: Monday, May 24, 1999 2:21 PM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Now about 1hs vs 2hs Re: Rangers and warriors
>
>
> From: David Rogers <derogers334@...>
>
> --- Jason Coan <COANJ@...> wrote:
> > 1. You also need to throw weight into that
> > equation. Because even tho a mino axe has a better
> > ratio than a FS sword, but after about 3 mobs your
> > stamina is shot, which lowers your stats, including
> > your attack ability. Try the same thing with 2 FS
> > long swords and you'll still have plenty of stamina.
>
> That's a good point, one I've not considered. I haven't yet had any
> problems with either of my characters yet in the Stamina department
> (Dwarven Paladin and Troll Warrior); I only have Stamina problems when
> I'm fleeing across zones, jumping to stay ahead of them. But it's an
> excellent point; the Mino axe is *heavy*.
>
> Weight also impacts your possible lootage potential; lighter 'carry'
> gear/weapons = more loot to take back! This has got to be a good
> thing, neh?
>
> > 2. That would depend on what you are fighting, and
> > you must also calculate in the reposte skill. When
> > you can reposte for 10 points with a 1h slash or 44
> > points with a 2h slash, bit of a difference there.
>
> I know nothing about Riposte; neither of my characters have it, and no
> one on any of the boards/lists/sites I read has said anything about it.
> Anyone have info re: Riposte? I'd love to hear it.
>
> ===
